cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Turning northwest later today and slowing, then tracking toward the middle Texas coast and expected to stall near the coast through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port Mansfield–Matagorda (close to Corpus Christi/Rockport area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Matagorda TX; Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast, roughly Port Mansfield northward through High Island, including Corpus Christi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely by Friday, with a 49 % chance of sustained 50-kt (≥58 mph) winds and an 8 % chance of hurricane-force winds at Corpus Christi.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 6–10 ft possible along the coast near and northeast of the landfall point, including Corpus Christi Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 12–20 inches of rain with isolated maxima to 30 inches forecast along the middle Texas coast, producing serious freshwater flooding in the port region.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large destructive waves, dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged flooding because the cyclone is expected to stall near the coast.
